competitors.name: Bittensor
competitors.description: A decentralized machine learning network where participants are rewarded for providing valuable intelligence and models. It uses a unique sub-network structure for different AI tasks.
competitors.tokenomics: Max supply 21M (halving cycles like BTC), fair launch, used for staking and governance.
competitors.differentiator_vs_wattcoin: Focuses on the model layer (intelligence) whereas WattCoin focuses on the agentic orchestration and micro-task layer (action).
competitors.community: Large institutional and dev community; ~150k Twitter followers.
competitors.strengths: Strong network effect, high-quality output, established ecosystem.
competitors.weaknesses: High barrier to entry for miners/validators, complexity of subnet governance.

competitors.name: Artificial Superintelligence Alliance
competitors.description: An open platform for the new AI economy, enabling autonomous economic agents to search, negotiate, and transact without human intervention.
competitors.tokenomics: Unified token after merging with AGIX and OCEAN; used for agent registration and services.
competitors.differentiator_vs_wattcoin: FET is more focused on the Autonomous Economic Agent (AEA) framework and high-level negotiation; WattCoin is a lean utility for rapid agent-to-agent tasking on Solana.
competitors.architecture: Cosmos SDK based with Ethereum bridge; multi-agent system framework.
competitors.strengths: Strong team, institutional partnerships (Bosch), integrated ecosystem.
competitors.weaknesses: Centralization concerns during the ASI transition, fragmented ecosystem.

competitors.name: Render Network
competitors.description: A decentralized GPU rendering platform that connects users looking to perform render jobs with people who have idle GPUs.
competitors.tokenomics: Burn-and-Mint Equilibrium (BME) model; inflationary rewards with burn mechanism based on usage.
competitors.differentiator_vs_wattcoin: Specialized in high-end GPU compute for graphics/video; WattCoin is generalized for AI agent micro-tasks and automation.
competitors.architecture: DePIN model on Solana, utilizing distributed GPU nodes.
competitors.community: Strong creative and technical community; 300k+ Twitter followers.
competitors.strengths: Real-world utility, high demand in AI/VR sectors, Solana's speed.
competitors.weaknesses: Competition from centralized render farms, GPU hardware volatility.

competitors.name: Akash Network
competitors.description: A decentralized cloud computing marketplace that allows anyone to lease their computing resources for hosting applications.
competitors.tokenomics: Max supply ~388M, used for staking, securing the network, and as a medium of exchange.
competitors.differentiator_vs_wattcoin: Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) for any app; WattCoin is specialized for AI agent orchestration and task-based economy.
competitors.architecture: Cosmos SDK, Tendermint consensus; decentralized cloud compute.
competitors.strengths: Cost-effective compared to AWS/Google Cloud, open-source ethos.
competitors.weaknesses: User experience barrier for non-devs, lower adoption vs centralized clouds.

competitors.name: Nosana
competitors.description: A decentralized GPU grid for AI inference, allowing developers to run AI models on distributed hardware at lower costs.
competitors.tokenomics: Used for paying compute fees and staking by node operators.
competitors.differentiator_vs_wattcoin: Direct competitor in AI compute on Solana; Nosana focuses on the raw inference layer while WattCoin adds the agentic marketplace layer.
competitors.architecture: Solana-based DePIN; specialized in AI inference workloads.
competitors.community: Fast-growing Solana AI community; 50k+ Twitter followers.
competitors.strengths: Low cost, Solana native, highly optimized for AI.
competitors.weaknesses: Early stage, hardware supply constraints, competing with Render.

competitors.name: Aethir
competitors.description: A decentralized cloud infrastructure provider focused on high-end gaming and AI processing power distribution.
competitors.tokenomics: Used for node operator rewards and ecosystem payments.
competitors.differentiator_vs_wattcoin: Enterprise-grade GPU focus; WattCoin is more 'grassroots' and agent-focused (API-first).
competitors.strengths: High-performance hardware, strong partnerships in gaming.
competitors.weaknesses: More centralized vendor selection, complex token structure.

competitors.name: NodeAI
competitors.description: A platform providing simplified access to GPU nodes for AI and compute, featuring a revenue-sharing model for stakers.
competitors.tokenomics: Revenue sharing in ETH for token holders; tax on transactions.
competitors.differentiator_vs_wattcoin: Focuses on node-as-a-service and staking rewards; WattCoin focuses on functional agent tasks.
competitors.strengths: Easy staking UI, direct ETH rewards.
competitors.weaknesses: Ethereum gas fees for micro-tasks, tax-based tokenomics can be a turn-off.
